page.title: 08DANBURY YOUTH CAMP
page.content: The camp site was established in 1947 by Essex County Council.It was established to serve the youth of Essex.There is a resident warden,an assistant warden and two full time workers and a part time worker who are based at the camp site.The Youth Camp is situated in 70 acres of grass and woodland. During each year approximately 8-10,000 people visit the site. There are two categories of visitors category A are catered for by the camp facilities and equipment, category B are self catering people. There are 15 marquees and 70 tents on the camp.There are many courses and activites are held at the camp like horse shows, football, field study sites and walking.The Youth Camp is a suitably located base for visitors who wish to discover rural Essex,bustling London,and marvellous Danbury!
